title: Great ditrigonal icosidodecahedron
text:
In <a href="geometry">geometry</a>, the great ditrigonal icosidodecahedron (or great ditrigonary icosidodecahedron) is a <a href="nonconvex%20uniform%20polyhedron">nonconvex uniform polyhedron</a>, indexed as U47. It has 32 faces (20 <a href="triangle">triangle</a>s and 12 <a href="pentagon">pentagon</a>s), 60 edges, and 20 vertices. It has 4 <a href="Schwarz%20triangle">Schwarz triangle</a> equivalent constructions, for example <a href="Wythoff%20symbol">Wythoff symbol</a> 3 | 3 gives <a href="Coxeter%20diagram">Coxeter diagram</a> = . It has extended <a href="Schl%C3%A4fli%20symbol">Schläfli symbol</a> a,3} or c{3,}, as an "altered great stellated dodecahedron" or "converted great icosahedron".
Its <a href="circumradius">circumradius</a> is times the length of its edge, a value it shares with the <a href="cube">cube</a>.
Related polyhedra.
Its <a href="convex%20hull">convex hull</a> is a regular <a href="dodecahedron">dodecahedron</a>. It additionally shares its <a href="edge%20arrangement">edge arrangement</a> with the <a href="small%20ditrigonal%20icosidodecahedron">small ditrigonal icosidodecahedron</a> (having the triangular faces in common), the <a href="ditrigonal%20dodecadodecahedron">ditrigonal dodecadodecahedron</a> (having the pentagonal faces in common), and the regular <a href="compound%20of%20five%20cubes">compound of five cubes</a>.
